unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: What is it?
question_text:
The following table represents a cumulative probability distribution for $x$:
Which of the following answers correctly explains the meaning of the value of $0.72$?
tables:
$x$$4 $$5$$ 6$$7$$ 8$
$?$$ 0.32$$ 0.54$$ 0.72$$0.86$$1.0$

choices.text: The number $0.72$ is simply the value that is associated with the number $6$ in the distribution.
Because it is cumulative, divide $0.72$ by $6$, and then you will find that the probability of obtaining a $6$ for the random variable, $x$, will occur $12\%$ of the time.
The value $0.72$ is the probability that the random variable, $x$, will equal to $6$ a total of $72\%$ of the time.
The value $0.72$ is the probability that the random variable, $x$, will take on a value greater than or equal to $6$ a total of $72\%$ of the time.
The value $0.72$ is the probability that the random variable, $x$, will take on a value less than or equal to $6$ a total of $72\%$ of the time.
